text: Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
speaker: Narrator

text: who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the same manner that the sufferings of the Christ abound in us, so also our consolation abounds by Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if we are afflicted, it is for your consolation and saving health, which is effected in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer; or if we are comforted, it is for your consolation and saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: And our hope of you is steadfast, being certain, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so shall ye be also of the consolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because, brothers, we would not have you ignore our tribulation which was done unto us in Asia, that we were burdened beyond our strength, in such a manner that we despaired even of life:
speaker: Narrator

text: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God who raises the dead;
speaker: Narrator

text: who delivered us from so great a death and does deliver; in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;
speaker: Narrator

text: ye also helping us with prayer, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons, thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with carnal wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world and more abundantly towards you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we write no other things unto you than what ye read or also know, and I trust ye shall know them even to the end
speaker: Narrator

text: as also ye have known in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before that ye might have a second grace
speaker: Narrator

text: and to pass by you into Macedonia and to come again out of Macedonia unto you and of you to be sent forward to Judaea.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I, therefore, was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that of me there should be yes, yes, and no, no?
speaker: Narrator

text: But God is faithful that our word toward you has not been yes and no.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timothy, has not been yes and no, but in him was yes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the promises of God are yes in him, and in him Amen, by us for the glory of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he who confirms us with you unto Christ and has anointed us is God;
speaker: Narrator

text: who has also sealed us and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I call God for a witness upon my soul that I have not yet come unto Corinth to spare you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy, for by faith ye stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in grief.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if I make you grieve, who is he then that shall make me glad, but the same who is grieved by me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And I wrote this same unto you, lest when I came, I should have grief from those of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know how much more charity I have towards you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any have caused me grief, he has not grieved me, but in part, that I may not put a burden on you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sufficient to such a one is this reprehension, which was inflicted of many.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that contrariwise ye ought rather to forgive him and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with too much grief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I beseech you that ye would confirm your charity toward him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to this end also I wrote, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye are obedient in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom ye forgive any thing, I forgive also; for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave it, for your sakes I forgave it in the person of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest Satan should deceive us, for we do not ignore his devices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having come to Troas for the gospel of the Christ, even though a door was opened unto me in the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: I had no rest in my spirit because I did not find Titus my brother, but taking my leave of them, I went from there into Macedonia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now thanks be unto God, who always causes us to triumph in the Christ and makes manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in those that are saved and in those that perish;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the one we are the savour of death unto death and to the other the savour of life unto life. And who is sufficient for these things?
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are not as many, false merchandisers of the word of God, but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God we speak in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or do we need, as some others, epistles of commendation to you or letters of commendation from you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:
speaker: Narrator

text: Forasmuch as ye are manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And such trust we have through the Christ towards God:
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think anything as of ourselves, but our sufficiency is of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who also has made us able ministers of the new testament, not of the letter, but of the Spirit; for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the ministry of death in the letter engraved in stones was glorious, so that the sons of Israel could not steadfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance which glory was to fade away,
speaker: Narrator

text: How shall not the ministry of the Spirit be for greater glory?
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the ministry of condemnation had glory, much more shall the ministry of righteousness abound in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even that which was so glorious had no glory in this respect, in comparison with the glory that excels.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if that which fades away was glorious, much more shall that which remains be glorious.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing then that we have such hope, we speak with great confidence,
speaker: Narrator

text: And not as Moses, who put a veil over his face, that the sons of Israel could not steadfastly look to the end of that glory which was to fade away:
speaker: Narrator

text: (And thus their senses became hardened, for until this day remains the same veil not uncovered in the reading of the old testament, which veil is taken away in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even unto this day when Moses is read, the veil is upon their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless when they convert to the Lord, the veil shall be taken away.)
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is the Spirit, and where that Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we all, beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord with uncovered face, are transformed from glory to glory into the same likeness, even as by the Spirit of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, according to the mercy we have received, we fault not,
speaker: Narrator

text: but remove from ourselves every hidden shameful thing, not walking in craftiness, nor adulterating the word of God, but in the manifestation of the truth, commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if our gospel is hid, it is hid to those that are lost,
speaker: Narrator

text: In whom the god of this age has blinded the understanding of those who do not believe, that the light of the gospel of the glory of the Christ, who is the image of God, should not shine in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord, and ourselves your slaves for Jesus’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, has shined in our hearts to bring forth the light of the knowledge of the clarity of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we have this treasure in clay vessels that the excellency of the virtue may be of God, and not of us.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; we are unsure of our lives, but not in despair;
speaker: Narrator

text: persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;
speaker: Narrator

text: always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we who live are always delivered unto death for Jesus’ sake that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then death works in us, but life in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: We having the same Spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed and, therefore, I have spoken; we also believe and, therefore, speak;
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing that he who raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise us up also by Jesus and shall present us with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we suffer all these things for your sakes that the grace abounding through many may in the thanksgiving redound to the glory of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we fault not; but though our outward man is wearing out, yet the inward man is renewed day by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our tribulation, which is momentary and light, prepares an exceeding and eternal weight of glory unto us;
speaker: Narrator

text: while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen, for the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we know that if the earthly house of this our habitation were dissolved, we have a building of God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: if so be that we shall be found clothed and not naked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan, being burdened, for we do not desire to be unclothed, but to be clothed upon with life swallowing up that which is mortal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he that has made us for this same thing is God, who has likewise given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we are always confident, knowing that while we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text: (for we walk by faith, not by sight).
speaker: Narrator

text: We are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body and to be present with the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we also procure, whether present or absent, that we may please him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ that each one may receive according to that which they have done in the body, good or evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore being certain of that terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God, and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we do not commend ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf that ye may have something to answer those who glory in appearance, and not in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whether we are fools, it is unto God; or whether we are sane, it is for your cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the charity of the Christ constrains us because we judge thus: that if one died for all, then all are dead:
speaker: Narrator

text: And that he died for all that those who live should not live from now on unto themselves, but unto him who died and rose again for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore from now on we know no one according to the flesh: and even if we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet now we know him no longer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if anyone is in Christ, they are a new creation: old things are passed away; behold, all things are made new.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all this by God, who reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and gave us the ministry of reconciliation;
speaker: Narrator

text: for certainly God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them and having placed in us the word of reconciliation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did exhort you by us; we beseech you in Christ’s name, be ye reconciled to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin, that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: We then, as workers together with him, exhort you also that ye have not received the grace of God in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For he saith, I have heard thee in an acceptable time, and in the day of saving health I have succoured thee; behold, now is the acceptable time; behold, now is the day of saving health.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Giving no offense in anything, that the ministry not be blamed,
speaker: Narrator

text: But in all things showing ourselves as the ministers of God in much patience, in tribulations, in necessities, in distresses,
speaker: Narrator

text: in stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings,
speaker: Narrator

text: in chastity, in knowledge, in meekness, in kindness, in the Holy Spirit, in unfeigned charity,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the word of truth, in the power of God through the weapons of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,
speaker: Narrator

text: through honour and dishonour, through evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet as men of the truth;
speaker: Narrator

text: as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, but, behold, we live; as chastened, but not killed;
speaker: Narrator

text: as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now for a recompense in the same (I speak as unto my children), be ye also enlarged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers, for what fellowship does righteousness have with unrighteousness? and what communion does light have with darkness?
speaker: Narrator

text: And what concord does Christ have with Belial? or what part do the faithful have with the unfaithful?
speaker: Narrator

text: And what agreement does the temple of God have with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God has said, I will dwell in them and walk in them and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and do not touch the unclean thing; and I will receive you
speaker: Narrator

text: and will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.
speaker: Narrator

text: I speak this not to condemn you, for I have said before that ye are in our hearts to die and live together with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great is my glorying of you; I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without were fightings, within were fears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless God, who comforts the humble, comforted us by the coming of Titus;
speaker: Narrator

text: and not by his coming only, but by the consolation with which he was comforted in you when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your zeal for me so that I rejoiced the more.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent; for I perceive that the same epistle has made you sorry, though it were but for a season.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance; for ye were made sorry by God that ye might suffer no loss by us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For godly sorrow works repentance to salvation, of which there is no need to repented; but the sorrow of the world works death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For behold this same thing, that when ye were made sorry by God, what carefulness it wrought in you, what clearing of yourselves, what indignation, what fear, what vehement desire, what zeal, what vindication! In all things ye have shown yourselves to be clean in this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that, though I wrote unto you, I did it not only for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we were comforted in your comfort; yea, and we rejoiced even more exceedingly for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if I have gloried of anything to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spoke all things to you in truth, even so our glorying, which I made before Titus, was found true.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his inward affection is more abundant toward you while he remembers the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise, brethren, we make known unto you the grace of God bestowed on the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of Macedonia,
speaker: Narrator

text: how that in a great trial of tribulation the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to their power, I bear record, and even beyond their power they were willing of themselves,
speaker: Narrator

text: praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the grace and take upon us the fellowship of the ministry to the saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this they did, not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord and then unto us by the will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Insomuch that we exhorted Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also complete among you the same grace also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith and in word and in knowledge and in all diligence and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.
speaker: Narrator

text: I speak not as commanding, but by occasion of the diligence of others and to prove the sincerity of your charity.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor that ye through his poverty might be enriched.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in this I give my advice, for this is expedient for you, who began not only to do, but also to be diligent a year ago.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore finish the doing of it that as there was a readiness to will, so there may also be a performance out of that which ye have.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if there is first a willing desire, it is accepted according to what a person has and not according to what they do not have.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I mean not that others be eased and ye burdened,
speaker: Narrator

text: but by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their want that their abundance also may be a supply for your want, that there may be equality:
speaker: Narrator

text: As it is written, He that had gathered much had nothing over, and he that had gathered little had no lack.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thanks be to God, who put the same diligence into the heart of Titus for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed he accepted the exhortation, but being more diligent, of his own accord he went unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we have sent with him the brother whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the congregations, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
speaker: Narrator

text: and not that only, but who was also ordained by the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord and declaration of your ready desire,
speaker: Narrator

text: avoiding that anyone should blame us regarding this abundance which is ministered by us,
speaker: Narrator

text: providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which we have in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Regarding Titus, he is my partner and fellowhelper concerning you; or regarding our brethren, they are the apostles of the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} and the glory of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore show ye unto them before the congregations, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} the proof of your charity and of our glorying regarding you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For regarding the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know your ready desire, for which I gloried of you to those of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago, and your zeal has provoked many.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I have sent the brethren lest our glorying of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest haply if those of Macedonia come with me and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed of this our confidence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would first go unto you and prepare beforehand your blessing, of which ye had given notice before that the same might be ready as a blessing, and not as of covetousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this I say, He who sows sparingly shall reap also sparingly, and he who sows in blessings shall also reap blessings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each one according as they purpose in their heart, so let them give, not grudgingly or of necessity; for God loves a cheerful giver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God is able to make all grace abound in you that ye, always having all sufficiency in all things, may abound to every good work:
speaker: Narrator

text: As it is written, He has dispersed abroad; he has given to the poor; his righteousness remains for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he that supplies seed to the sower shall also supply bread for food and shall multiply your seed sown and shall increase the growing of the fruits of your righteousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that being enriched in everything to all generosity, which works out through us thanksgiving unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the administration of this service not only supplies the needs of the saints, but also abounds in much thanksgiving unto God;
speaker: Narrator

text: that by the experience of this ministration, they glorify God for the obedience of your consent unto the gospel of the Christ and in your liberal distribution unto them and unto everyone,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in their prayer for you, for they love you because of the eminent grace of God in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thanks be unto God for his indescribable gift.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I, Paul, myself beseech you by the meekness and clemency of the Christ (who in presence am low among you, but being absent am bold toward you)
speaker: Narrator

text: but I beseech you that I need not be bold when I am present with that confidence, with which I am esteemed to use against some who regard us as if we walked according to the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God for the destruction of strong holds),
speaker: Narrator

text: casting down reasonings and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God and leading captive every thought into the obedience of the Christ
speaker: Narrator

text: and having a readiness to avenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If anyone trusts to himself that he is Christ’s, let him of himself think this again, that as he is Christ’s, even so we are Christ’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though I should glory somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord has given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I shall not be ashamed,
speaker: Narrator

text: That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.
speaker: Narrator

text: For his letters, they say, are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let such a one think this, that such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such will we be also in deed when we are present.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we dare not mix ourselves in with or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves, but they do not understand that they are measuring themselves by themselves and comparing themselves among themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will not glory of things beyond our measure, but according to the measure of the rule, of the measure which God has distributed to us, to reach even unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we do not overextend ourselves by reaching unto you; for we are also come unto you with the gospel of the Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: Not glorying of things beyond our measure in the labours of others; but having hope of the increase of your faith, that we shall be abundantly enlarged among you according to our rule,
speaker: Narrator

text: to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, without entering into the measure {Gr. rule} of another to glory in that which has already been made ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that glories, let him glory in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is not he that commends himself that is approved, but whom the Lord commends.
speaker: Narrator

text: I wish ye could bear with me a little in my folly and indeed bear with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am jealous over you with the jealousy of God, for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I fear that as the serpent deceived Eve through his craftiness, so your senses should be corrupted in some way, and ye should fall from the simplicity that is in the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if anyone comes preaching another Jesus whom we have not preached or if ye receive another spirit from that which ye have received or another gospel from that which ye have accepted, ye bear well with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I reckon that I have not been inferior in any way to those grandiose apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: But though I am rude in speech, yet not in knowledge, but we have been thoroughly made manifest among you in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have I committed an offence in humbling myself that ye might be exalted because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?
speaker: Narrator

text: I deprived the other congregations, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} taking wages of them, to do you service.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when I was present with you and had need, I was not a burden to any of you, for that which was lacking to me was supplied by the brethren which came from Macedonia; and in all things I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and so will I keep myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the truth of Christ in me that this glory shall not be sealed up unto me in the regions of Achaia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why? because I do not love you? God knows.
speaker: Narrator

text: But what I do, I will continue to do that I may take away the occasion from those who desire it to be found like unto us in that in which they glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these false apostles are deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it is no marvel, for Satan himself transforms himself into an angel of light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers transform themselves as ministers of righteousness, whose end shall be according to their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say again, Let no one think me a fool if otherwise, receive me as a fool, that I may yet glory a little.
speaker: Narrator

text: That which I speak, I speak it not according to the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye yourselves are wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye suffer it if anyone brings you into bondage, if anyone devours you, if anyone takes of you, if anyone exalts himself, if anyone smites you on the face.
speaker: Narrator

text: I speak as concerning the reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit in that in which another is bold, (I speak foolishly), I am bold also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Are they Hebrews? so am I. Are they Israelites? so am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so am I.
speaker: Narrator

text: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more, in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths often.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Jews five times I received forty stripes less one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times I was beaten with rods, once I was stoned; three times I suffered shipwreck, night and day I have been in the deep;
speaker: Narrator

text: in journeyings often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils by those of my nation, in perils of the Gentiles, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils among false brethren;
speaker: Narrator

text: in labour and travail, in many watches, in hunger and thirst, in many fasts, in cold and nakedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside those things that are without, my daily combat is the welfare of all the congregations. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is sick, and I am not sick? who stumbles, and I burn not?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern my weakness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed for evermore, knows that I do not lie.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and through a window in a basket I was let down by the wall and escaped his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly it is not expedient for me to glory, but I will come to the visions and the revelations of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell; God knows) was caught up to the third heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I know such a man (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell; God knows)
speaker: Narrator

text: who was caught up into paradise and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of such a one I will glory, yet of myself I will not glory, except in my weaknesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if I should desire to glory in these things, I should not be a fool; for I would say the truth, but now I forbear lest anyone should think of me above that which he sees me to be or that he hears of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lest the greatness of the revelations should exalt me above measure, there is given to me a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this thing I besought the Lord three times that it might be taken from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee; for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly, therefore, I will rather glory in my weaknesses that the power of Christ may dwell in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I am content in weaknesses, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ’s sake, for when I am weak, then am I strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been a fool, glorying; ye have compelled me; for I ought to have been commended of you, for in nothing am I behind the grandiose apostles, though I am nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly the signs of the apostle were worked out among you in all patience, in signs and wonders and power.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what is it in which ye were inferior to the other congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} except in that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you, and I will not be burdensome to you, for I seek not your things, but you; for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will very gladly spend and be utterly spent for your souls though the more abundantly I love you, the less I am loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be it so, I did not burden you; nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did I make a gain of you by any of those whom I sent unto you?
speaker: Narrator

text: I besought Titus and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus defraud you? Did we not walk in the same Spirit and in the same steps?
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, do ye think that we excuse ourselves unto you? We speak before God in Christ, but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I desire and that I shall be found unto you such as ye desire not, lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, rumours, tumults,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and I would have to mourn over many who have sinned already and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This third time I am coming unto you. In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.
speaker: Narrator

text: I told you before and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now, I write to those who until now have sinned and to all others that, if I come again, I will not spare,
speaker: Narrator

text: Since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, who unto you is not weak, but is mighty in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he lives by the power of God. By which we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him by the power of God in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Examine yourselves whether ye are in the faith; prove your own selves. Do ye not know your own selves if Jesus Christ is in you? Unless ye are reprobates.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I pray to God that ye do no evil, not that we should appear approved, but that ye should do that which is good, though we be as reprobates.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: By which we are glad that we are weak and ye are strong, and even so we pray for your perfection.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I write these things being absent lest being present I should treat you with more severity, according to the power which the Lord has given me for edification, and not for destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the rest, brethren, that ye may have joy, be perfected, have consolation, be of one mind, having peace; and the God of peace and charity shall be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet one another with a holy kiss.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the saints salute you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the charity of God and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
